page.title: 08 Wilnecote Fun Run
page.content: The second annual Fun Run took place onSunday 19th May from Wilnecote High School. The 828 runners of all ages ran from Hedging Lane to Dosthill up to Two Gates and back to Wilnecote. The winner was Steve Portman, a local runner who ran the 5 miles in 26 minutes 2 seconds. There were runners from all over the country including London and Wales. The organiser of this, one of the biggest Fun Runs in the Midlands, Mr David Owen, said, "The greatest thrill was seeing the runners lining up at the start and seeing local Wilnecote Junior School pupil Russell Orchard, a spina bifida victim, crossing the line." It is hoped to hold a similar event next year.
